Key Arguments: The legislation threatens free speech and open debate in Australia.
It could lead to government censorship similar to oppressive regimes like China.
Misinformation and disinformation are subjective, as demonstrated during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The bill could be used to silence opposition and control public discourse.
The legislation is seen as a threat to democracy and individual freedom of expression.
The cost of implementing and enforcing the bill would be enormous and could be better spent elsewhere.
Notable Quotes: We have been able to voice our opinion openly, be it privately or publicly, without censorship. It seems that is about to change.
This Bill is extremely dangerous to our democracy, which relies on inclusion of differing ideas and the ability of citizens to be free to express their opinions.
Misinformation and disinformation is very subjective as has been demonstrated very recently during Covid pandemic.
